jobDescription: This selected Data Scientist candidate will serve as an integral member of the team on a commercial business group ingesting, organizing, storing, creating, and disseminating data and insight for a vast array of internal and external information consumers. This position applies techniques and theories from math, statistics, data science and engineering, visualization, and high performance computing with the goal of extracting meaningful data to address complex problems. The data scientist will serve as the subject matter expert (SME) to the software engineering, weather and imagery analysis operations, research science, and business management teams. This position requires someone who has the passion, organization, and vision to not only take ownership of their own technology stacks but to also work with various teams to create cutting edge products and services. If you have a passion for the atmospheric and geospatial sciences plus the background to handle complex data workflows in a fast-paced dynamic environment, we have an exciting opportunity for you. Essential Job FunctionsBuild high-performance algorithms, prototypes, predictive models and proof of conceptsDesign and develop advanced algorithms for the purpose of analyzing large amounts of data from disparate sourcesDiscover and communicate meaningful patterns from large data setsEmploy elements of artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistics, and database systems to develop analytic methodologiesIdentify and implement techniques to improve data reliability, efficiency and qualityCollaborate with the sales, operations, and management team to develop new tools and systems for the purpose of creating value add solutions for both internal and external customersFundamentally take your knowledge of the physical sciences along with your experience in the computer sciences to do something great and change the way the world looks at, consumes, and uses data
